#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=THE SCHARTZ-METTERKLUME METHOD

#Text=Lady Carlotta stepped out on to the platform of the small wayside station and took a turn or two up and down its uninteresting length , to kill time till the train should be pleased to proceed on its way .

#Text=Then , in the roadway beyond , she saw a horse struggling with a more than ample load , and a carter of the sort that seems to bear a sullen hatred against the animal that helps him to earn a living .
#Text=Lady Carlotta promptly betook her to the roadway , and put rather a different complexion on the struggle .

#Text=Certain of her acquaintances were wont to give her plentiful admonition as to the undesirability of interfering on behalf of a distressed animal , such interference being “ none of her business . ”

#Text=Only once had she put the doctrine of non-interference into practice , when one of its most eloquent exponents had been besieged for nearly three hours in a small and extremely uncomfortable may-tree by an angry boar-pig , while Lady Carlotta , on the other side of the fence , had proceeded with the water-colour sketch she was engaged on , and refused to interfere between the boar and his prisoner .
#Text=It is to be feared that she lost the friendship of the ultimately rescued lady .
#Text=On this occasion she merely lost the train , which gave way to the first sign of impatience it had shown throughout the journey , and steamed off without her .
#Text=She bore the desertion with philosophical indifference ; her friends and relations were thoroughly well used to the fact of her luggage arriving without her .
#Text=She wired a vague non-committal message to her destination to say that she was coming on “ by another train . ”
#Text=Before she had time to think what her next move might be she was confronted by an imposingly attired lady , who seemed to be taking a prolonged mental inventory of her clothes and looks .
#Text=“ You must be Miss Hope , the governess I ’ve come to meet , ” said the apparition , in a tone that admitted of very little argument .
#Text=“ Very well , if I must I must , ” said Lady Carlotta to herself with dangerous meekness .
#Text=“ I am Mrs. Quabarl , ” continued the lady ;
#Text=“ and where , pray , is your luggage ? ”

#Text=“ It ’s gone astray , ” said the alleged governess , falling in with the excellent rule of life that the absent are always to blame ; the luggage had , in point of fact , behaved with perfect correctitude .
#Text=“ I ’ve just telegraphed about it , ” she added , with a nearer approach to truth .
#Text=“ How provoking , ” said Mrs. Quabarl ; “ these railway companies are so careless .
#Text=However , my maid can lend you things for the night , ” and she led the way to her car .

#Text=During the drive to the Quabarl mansion Lady Carlotta was impressively introduced to the nature of the charge that had been thrust upon her ; she learned that Claude and Wilfrid were delicate , sensitive young people , that Irene had the artistic temperament highly developed , and that Viola was something or other else of a mould equally commonplace among children of that class and type in the twentieth century .
#Text=“ I wish them not only to be taught , ” said Mrs. Quabarl , “ but interested in what they learn .

#Text=In their history lessons , for instance , you must try to make them feel that they are being introduced to the life-stories of men and women who really lived , not merely committing a mass of names and dates to memory .
#Text=French , of course , I shall expect you to talk at meal-times several days in the week . ”
#Text=“ I shall talk French four days of the week and Russian in the remaining three . ”
#Text=“ Russian ?
#Text=My dear Miss Hope , no one in the house speaks or understands Russian . ”
#Text=“ That will not embarrass me in the least , ” said Lady Carlotta coldly .
#Text=Mrs. Quabarl , to use a colloquial expression , was knocked off her perch .
#Text=She was one of those imperfectly self-assured individuals who are magnificent and autocratic as long as they are not seriously opposed .
#Text=The least show of unexpected resistance goes a long way towards rendering them cowed and apologetic .

#Text=When the new governess failed to express wondering admiration of the large newly-purchased and expensive car , and lightly alluded to the superior advantages of one or two makes which had just been put on the market , the discomfiture of her patroness became almost abject .

#Text=Her feelings were those which might have animated a general of ancient warfaring days , on beholding his heaviest battle-elephant ignominiously driven off the field by slingers and javelin throwers .
#Text=At dinner that evening , although reinforced by her husband , who usually duplicated her opinions and lent her moral support generally , Mrs. Quabarl regained none of her lost ground .

#Text=The governess not only helped herself well and truly to wine , but held forth with considerable show of critical knowledge on various vintage matters , concerning which the Quabarls were in no wise able to pose as authorities .
#Text=Previous governesses had limited their conversation on the wine topic to a respectful and doubtless sincere expression of a preference for water .
#Text=When this one went as far as to recommend a wine firm in whose hands you could not go very far wrong Mrs. Quabarl thought it time to turn the conversation into more usual channels .
#Text=“ We got very satisfactory references about you from Canon Teep , ” she observed ;
#Text=“ a very estimable man , I should think . ”
